author: TioBella
title: Can't Go Wrong
review:
These $10 City Starter Sets are almost always a great deal.

Box/Instructions

Typical City box with one instruction book.  The instructions do have an accounting of the parts at the back.

Parts

Nothing special though you do get two of the blue crystals along with one red boulder.

Minifigures

This is where the set could have been awesome.  4 figures is great for the price but they don't give you the coolest figure in the Volcano line - the dude suited up in silver with the logo on his chest.  This figure only comes with the two most expensive sets (60124 & 60125), so it would have been nice if you could get one here.  Anyway, you get a female scientist, female explorer suited up, and two guys, one suited up.

The build

Anyone who has ever built a City ATV will find nothing new here.

The completed model

The little volcano is kind of sad and basically a waste of parts.

Overall opinion

Great way to fill out your Volcano layout with explorers and at a decent price. Shame they never had a set like this for Arctic!

author: BlueGalaxy47
title: Cool City Set
review:
The Volcano ATV included in this set looks nice as I like the lime green colour. I absolutely love the printed Volcano logo piece on the front, and I like the detail of the front section as well. The back also looks pretty nice with lights, an antenna, and a clip. I especially like the inclusion of the chain to link the ATV to the lava boulder.

The build of the volcano is nice, using a good amount of pieces. On the other hand, I feel like space to the side of the volcano is wasted.

The volcano action feature is actually pretty good and will be extremely fun especially for kids to do.

The boulder looks special and mysterious, which is a nice look for what it was going for.

The minifigures and accessories included are really really nice and effective for this Lego scene.

Overall, this is a fun set which includes some very nice stuff.

The only thing they could do better with this set is to add more stuff to the side of the volcano.
